g.text: Matsui et al. Magnesium-Based Intermetallic Anode Active Materials
have post annealing process, the Mg
poor crystallinity. The small peak observed at 22.6
corresponding the 003 reﬂection of the bismuth remained as
impurity phase. The peak of 012 reﬂection of the bismuth, which
is the main peak of the powder pattern, is not clearly observed,
hence the bismuth impurity phase has a preferred orientation
to c-axis to minimize the surface energy during the deposition
Comparison of cyclic voltammograms of Mg
sweep rates of the voltammetry are 0.1mV s
shows cyclic voltammograms of the Mg
ﬁlm electrodes in various electrolyte solutions: 1.0 mol L
thin ﬁlm shows reversible redox reaction in all the three
electrolyte solutions. The redox potentials of the Mg
/Ag, lower than the redox potential in AN electrolyte
solution; we suspect it is due to the diﬀerence of the Ag
redox potential in the reference electrode corresponding to the
solvation properties of AN and the glymes. The broad peaks of
the cyclic voltammogram of the BuMeG3 electrolyte solution
indicates that the redox reaction is kinetically slowdue to the high
viscosity of the solution. The overpotential between the anodic
100 mV, which is slightly higher than
that of AN, it is still much lower than the overpotential observed
in the deposition/dissolution process of the magnesium metal in
The excellent reversibility of the Mg
electrolyte solutions indicates that the surface of the Mg
electrodes are not passivated in these electrolyte solutions. Thus,
we performed XPS analyses of the Mg
metal thin ﬁlm immersed in the electrolyte solution to conﬁrm
the absence of the passivation layer. The BuMeG3 solution was
chosen for the surface analysis because we previously observed
-based passivation layer at the surface of
shows F1s XPS spectra of the sputtered Mg
metal thin ﬁlms. Despite our expectation, both of the thin
ﬁlms showed similar spectra to that we observed at the surface
of the magnesium foil. The spectra have peaks at 688.8 eV,
corresponding to the residue of the TFSA anion at the surface of
the electrodes. The TFSA residue gradually decreased and mostly
thin ﬁlm. The small peak at 22.6
corresponds to 003 reﬂection of bismuth. Two strong peaks
are corresponding to the copper substrate. All the other peaks match with the reference pattern of Mg
